com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer

Class Fuzzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer.Fuzzer

  • public class Fuzzer
extends Object
    Main class for fuzz testing. Instantiate this class with a set of ABNF rules and then call one of the generate methods to create random output suitable for use in a test.
    Author:
    Nick Radov

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws ParseException,
                        IOException
        Parse a set of ABNF rules and generate one or more matching random values. By default it reads the rules from stdin and writes one value to stdout. Command-line parameters can be used to read from and write to files, and to generate multiple values.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the command line can't be parsed
        IOException - if an error occurs reading the input or writing the output

      • generate

        public byte[] generate(String ruleName)
        Generate a random sequence of bytes which matches a named ABNF rule. The output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - ABNF rule name
        Returns:
        random sequence which matches the specified rule
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ruleName doesn't exist
        IllegalStateException - if any defined rule references another rule which doesn't exist
        See Also:
        generate(String, Set)

      • generateAscii

        public String generateAscii(String ruleName,
                            Set<String> exclude)
        Generate a random sequence of characters which matches a named ABNF rule. The output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - ABNF rule name
        exclude - ABNF rule names to exclude during alternative selection; this allows for testing code that implements only a subset of an RFC
        Returns:
        random sequence of characters which matches the specified rule encoded in the US_ASCII character set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ruleName doesn't exist
        IllegalStateException - if any defined rule references another rule which doesn't exist

      • generateAscii

        public String generateAscii(String ruleName)
        Generate a random sequence of characters which matches a named ABNF rule. The output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - ABNF rule name
        Returns:
        random sequence of characters which matches the specified rule encoded in the US_ASCII character set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ruleName doesn't exist
        IllegalStateException - if any defined rule references another rule which doesn't exist

      • generate

        public byte[] generate(String ruleName,
                       Set<String> exclude)
        Generate a random sequence of bytes which matches a named ABNF rule. The output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - ABNF rule name
        exclude - rule names to exclude when generating output
        Returns:
        random sequence of bytes which matches the specified rule
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ruleName doesn't exist
        IllegalStateException - if any defined rule references another rule which doesn't exist

      • generate

        public String generate(String ruleName,
                       Set<String> exclude,
                       Charset charset)
        Generate a random sequence of characters which matches a named ABNF rule. The output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
        Parameters:
        ruleName - ABNF rule name
        exclude - rule names to exclude when generating output
        charset - encoding for the return value
        Returns:
        random sequence of characters which matches the specified rule encoded in the specified character set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if ruleName doesn't exist
        IllegalStateException - if any defined rule references another rule which doesn't exist

      • getRandom

        public Random getRandom()
        Get the random number generator used to pick between options and alternatives.
        Returns:
        random number generator
        See Also:
        setRandom(Random)

      • setRandom

        public void setRandom(Random r)
        Set the random number generator used to pick between alternatives. If this isn't set then a default implementation will be used.
        Parameters:
        r - random number generator
        See Also:
        getRandom()
